info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 12:27AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: *** PATCHY BLACK ICE EARLY THIS MORNING *** A light onshore flow will gradually get established late in the overnight and into early this morning. Slightly warmer air going over a cold surface is expected to result in patchy black ice through early this morning. Also a weak weather disturbance just to the south along the Mid Atlantic coast will inch north and northeast. This could bring a round of very light precipitation before sunrise, especially across southern portions of the area. If precipitation occurs it is mostly expected to be in the form of light freezing rain or freezing drizzle. This would result in more widespread icy conditions. If freezing rain materializes a winter weather advisory would then need to be issued. Walkways and any untreated surfaces may be slippery! If driving, please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses, and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.
